source_caption_data.pre_caption: A wide shot, filmed from a low angle, captures several men disembarking from an airplane at night. The aircraft's tail, featuring a large American flag, is positioned in the top-center of the frame in the middle ground. A set of illuminated mobile stairs extends diagonally from the top right towards the bottom left, occupying the foreground and middle ground. The men, initially at the top of the stairs in the middle ground, walk down towards the camera, moving into the foreground as they descend. The primary subject, a man with light-colored hair, is centrally framed on the stairs, following another man. The camera remains stationary throughout the shot.

The claim that the primary subject is "centrally framed" conflicts with the described diagonal movement; his position would dynamically shift from the upper right towards the lower left, not remain static in the center. The caption also fails to mention the significant change in the subjects' scale; as the men descend from the middle ground towards the foreground, their size within the frame would increase, transitioning from a full shot to a medium shot. Furthermore, stating the stairs occupy both "foreground and middle ground" is vague; it would be more precise to describe the base of the stairs resting in the foreground and the top connecting to the aircraft in the middle ground. Finally, the description omits key environmental details that would establish depth, such as the dark tarmac occupying the immediate foreground beneath the stairs and perhaps distant, out-of-focus airport lights in the far background.
